summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 among law enforcement personnel, including an Assistant United States Attorney, coordinating schedules for a conference call and discussing updates related to the Epstein investigation. It references witness contact attempts, a defendant's phone being 'dumped,' and a planned trip.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sends emails requesting updates on the defendant's phone, a trip, and witness contact, and coordinates a conference call about the case.

events.title: Proposed Case Conference Call
events.description: A conference call is proposed for September 10, 2019, around 4pm to discuss the Epstein case.

events.title: Witness Contact Attempt by Private Investigator
events.description: A private investigator, hired by an unnamed individual, showed up and called a witness to try to get her to come see him.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Eastern District of New York, 271 Cadman Plaza East Brooklyn, NY 11201
keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively coordinating in August 2019 for updates and a call regarding the Epstein investigation.
A private investigator was hired to locate and contact a witness in the case, showing active efforts to influence testimony.
There was a focus on obtaining data from 'the defendant's phone' and whether it 'is being dumped now.'
The correspondence involves the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and a federal prosecutor.
Multiple individuals' names and email addresses are redacted throughout the document.
